messages: e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:45): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: the reason phone manufacturers rarely update *anything* is because there's no financial incentive to do so, and there is a fiscal penalty for doing so: if it breaks something on an operator's network, the operator will get pissed and ask for money back
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:46): plus, a mobile vendor (like nokia) makes money by selling (new) units, it doesn't make money from units once they are sold

e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:47): and in the rare case that a browser actually results in revenue (home/search kickbacks), that money is not sent back to a maintenance team for the product that generated it, instead it is treated as some sort of windfall and absorbed by the company or some future product at large team
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (21:49): 6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf: fwiw, iPhone Safari doesn't get updated often, just look at how long it took for them to fix the certificate disaster
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (21:50): is certainly not going to buy any iPhone anyway
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (21:51): N9 might be one option
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (21:51): but it is a bit too expensive
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (21:51): ... but google should not have put phone manufacturers in control of updating the browser, just as they're not in control of updating google apps
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (21:53): depends on which browser the OS has
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (21:54): hopes phone manufacturers would use some better browsers than stock browser
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (21:55): hopes Google will supply a sane browser (because it's their job) and phone manufacturers won't fragment things further
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (21:55): it is bad if Google controls the whole stack

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:09): 6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf: AIUI unless you pay Google (instead of getting Android for free) you can't ship the Google Apps and any non-standard application
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:10): 6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf: So OEMs take the default apps and Android for free
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:17): 6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf: The Google Apps are non-free.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:17): 6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf: (like Gmail, Market, etc.)

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:20): 6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf: So you have to get a license from Google to distribute them. They let you have it free in return for advertising revenue, or you can pay and change stuff.

e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:20): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: the reason phone manufacturers rarely update *anything* is because there's no financial incentive to do so, and there is a fiscal penalty for doing so: if it breaks something on an operator's network, the operator will get pissed and ask for money back

e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:21): plus, a mobile vendor (like nokia) makes money by selling (new) units, it doesn't make money from units once they are sold. and in the rare case that a browser actually results in revenue (home/search kickbacks), that money is not sent back to a maintenance team for the product that generated it, instead it is treated as some sort of windfall and absorbed by the company or some future product at l
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:21): arge team
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:21): hober: out of curiosity, which mobile vendors are actually good at browser updates?
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:21): 6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf: fwiw, iPhone Safari doesn't get updated often, just look at how long it took for them to fix the certificate disaster
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:21): i'm using irccloud
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (22:21): you're repeating yourself, heh
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:21): i thought i was offline and that things i had said weren't said
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:22): so i queued them in notepad and then sent them again
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:22): it didn't occur to me that they would have been sent
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:22): stuff in other places wasn't sent!
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:22): i believe a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 is correct about the Google Apps
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:22): which is a pretty good reason for major vendors to pay in
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:22): as for the n9... dunno
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:23): what's shocked me of late is that i've met a couple of people interested in n8s
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:23): s/people/women/
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:24): e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af: AFAIK almost no vendors pay.
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (22:35): e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af: n8?
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (22:36): isn't that, hmm, old
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (22:36): n9 has got lots of media time in Finland
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:36): the n8 is what i got nokia to buy for me right before i left
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:36): and yeah, it's old and sucks
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:36): but has a 12mp camera
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:37): oh, and it turns out that the "new" ui for symbian actually eventually made it out the doors!
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:37): so if i can find Lucy, i can let her consider replacing the old symbian ui with a worse one!
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:37): (but hey, it's "newer")
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:42): does nobody implement body.onmessage?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:43): or does nobody implement window.postMessage()?
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:44): <email/> or <email/> ?
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (22:44): the latter exists in Chrome, anyway
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:44): https://developer.mozilla.org/en/DOM/window.postMessage
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:44): every browser i've tested fails http://www.hixie.ch/tests/adhoc/dom/web-apps/postMessage/002.html
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:44): msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc197057(v=vs.85).aspx
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:44): and i can't work out if it's my fault or not :-)

e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:45): FAIL (message not received)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:45): guess i should test windows

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:45): so
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:45): is it my fault or what
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:45): i'm confused
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:45): oh i guess i nuke the iframe
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:45): maybe that's why
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:45): let's fix that

e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (22:47): but i'm still getting the fail
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:47): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: 002a.html calls it onmessage
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:47): e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af: k. thanks for the help.
